page.title: 06Housing
page.content: A neat, attractive residential area, with bungalows, houses, chalets and flats. There are 5 private housing estates, 1 council estate, and 2 pensioners residential homes, with several more roads of mixed housing. In Maldon Road there is an uninhabited derelict house and 4 beautiful cottages, one built in 1508 called Ann Cottage. On Vicarage Pines Estate the old Vicarage still stands. It was built in 1906. The estate has grown up over the last 3 years, and has 52 dwellings. Permission is being sought for 50 more. The Gleneagles Way Estate has roads named after famous golf courses. Like Woodham Drive and Ranulph Way, it is mainly detached housing, built in the 1970's, with lots of trees. There are well-kept semi-detached council houses in Remembrance Avenue and New Road.
